A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Extremely dissapointed at the mishandling of the Luke Skywalker charechter\, who was painted extremely differently to how the charechter is intended to be. Not only that but after being teased his reappearance after all of episode 7 to only see him for very brief segments was a let down.
The new trilogy charechters where bland and boring\, I've felt no connection to them\, whereas by episode 2 and 5 (The middle of their respective trilogy) I felt a strong attachment to the main heroes.
The plotline itself was very odd\, and felt... uninspired. A slow chase through space? How thrilling.
Also the movie took a random half hour break to a gambling based planet with Finn and the worst charechter to Grace the screen of a star wars movie since Jar Jar Binks\, 'Rose'. Where the two went off on an adventure to save the pwetty animals and learn how the upper class is bad.

The only good things about the entire movie was the charechter development of Kylo ren\, the only charechter the new films birthed worth a damn\, and Mark Hamill.
That's it. 
Bring back luke.
